title: How to Add Tags to Your Flickr Image

steps.headline: Wait for your image to finish uploading.
steps.description: Once successful, you will see a "Finished!" and Flickr will ask you if you want to add a description. Click the link.

steps.headline: Change the title of the image to what you like, add a description, and tags.
steps.description: Separate each tag with a comma. Note that you can add up to 75 tags per photo and if you have over 75 tags and wish to add more, you'll need to delete & replace some with previous tag names.

steps.headline: View the image you want to tag.

text:
Tagging a New Image Wait for your image to finish uploading. Once successful, you will see a "Finished!" and Flickr will ask you if you want to add a description. Click the link. Change the title of the image to what you like, add a description, and tags. Separate each tag with a comma. Note that you can add up to 75 tags per photo and if you have over 75 tags and wish to add more, you'll need to delete & replace some with previous tag names. Tagging Existing Images View the image you want to tag. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/6\/66\/Flickr3_292.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/6\/66\/Flickr3_292.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":532,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":878.9565217391304,"licensing":"

screenshot of my flickr account\n<\/p>

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}Look on the right hand side between the photostream/set selections and the "Additional Information" (for licensing). Click on "Add Tag".
